comment: Smart Data Models - Quality61850 adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/master/Quality61850/schema.json
description: Adapted from CIM data models. Quality flags in this class are as defined in IEC 61850, except for estimatorReplaced, which has been included in this class for convenience.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: badReference
contents.comment: Measurement value may be incorrect due to a reference being out of calibration. Default: False

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: estimatorReplaced
contents.comment: Value has been replaced by State Estimator. estimatorReplaced is not an IEC61850 quality bit but has been put in this class for convenience. Default: False

contents.name: failure
contents.comment: This identifier indicates that a supervision function has detected an internal or external failure, e.g. communication failure. Default: False

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: oldData
contents.comment: Measurement value is old and possibly invalid, as it has not been successfully updated during a specified time interval. Default: False

contents.name: operatorBlocked
contents.comment: Measurement value is blocked and hence unavailable for transmission. Default: False

contents.name: oscillatory
contents.comment: To prevent some overload of the communication it is sensible to detect and suppress oscillating (fast changing) binary inputs. If a signal changes in a defined time (tosc) twice in the same direction (from 0 to 1 or from 1 to 0) then oscillation is detected and the detail quality identifier `oscillatory` is set. If it is detected a configured numbers of transient changes could be passed by. In this time the validity status `questionable` is set. If after this defined numbers of changes the signal is still i

contents.name: outOfRange
contents.comment: Measurement value is beyond a predefined range of value. Default: False

contents.name: overFlow
contents.comment: Measurement value is beyond the capability of being  represented properly. For example, a counter value overflows from maximum count back to a value of zero. Default: False

contents.name: source
contents.comment: Source gives information related to the origin of a value. The value may be acquired from the process, defaulted or substituted. Default: None

contents.name: suspect
contents.comment: A correlation function has detected that the value is not consitent with other values. Typically set by a network State Estimator. Default: False

contents.name: test
contents.comment: Measurement value is transmitted for test purposes. Default: False

contents.name: validity
contents.comment: Validity of the measurement value. Default: None

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
